alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 8:06PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...From Monday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.1 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday evening to a crest of 12.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 03/30/1960. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
